verses.kjv: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.
verses.web: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings.
verses.ct: From James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the 12 tribes scattered across the world: Greetings.

verses.kjv: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;
verses.web: Count it all joy, my brothers, when you fall into various temptations,
verses.ct: My brothers and sisters, consider it pure joy when you face trials of every kind,

verses.kjv: Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.
verses.web: knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.
verses.ct: because you know that the testing of your faith builds endurance.

verses.kjv: But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.
verses.web: Let endurance have its perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.
verses.ct: Let that endurance do its full work in you, so that you become mature and complete, lacking nothing.

verses.kjv: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
verses.web: But if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach, and it will be given to him.
verses.ct: If any of you needs wisdom, ask God for it. He gives generously to everyone without finding fault, and it will be given to you.

verses.kjv: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.
verses.web: But let him ask in faith, without any doubting, for he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed.
verses.ct: But when you ask, you must believe and not doubt. A person who doubts is like a wave in the ocean, blown and tossed by the wind.

verses.kjv: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.
verses.web: For that man shouldn’t think that he will receive anything from the Lord.
verses.ct: That person shouldn't expect to receive anything from the Lord.

verses.kjv: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.
verses.web: He is a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways.
verses.ct: A double-minded person is unstable in everything they do.

verses.kjv: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:
verses.web: But let the brother in humble circumstances glory in his high position;
verses.ct: Believers who are poor should take pride in the high position God has given them.

verses.kjv: But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.
verses.web: and the rich, in that he is made humble, because like the flower in the grass, he will pass away.
verses.ct: And the rich should take pride in being brought low, because they will fade away like a wildflower.

verses.kjv: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.
verses.web: For the sun arises with the scorching wind and withers the grass, and the flower in it falls, and the beauty of its appearance perishes. So the rich man will also fade away in his pursuits.
verses.ct: The sun rises with scorching heat and dries up the grass; its flowers drop off and all their beauty is gone. In the same way, the rich will wither away even in the middle of their pursuits.

verses.kjv: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.
verses.web: Blessed is a person who endures temptation, for when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life, which the Lord promised to those who love him.
verses.ct: Blessed is the person who endures through trials, because once they've been proven faithful, they will receive the crown of life that the Lord has promised to those who love him.

verses.kjv: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:
verses.web: Let no man say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,” for God can’t be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one.
verses.ct: When someone is tempted, they should never say, "God is tempting me." God cannot be tempted by evil, and he doesn't tempt anyone.

verses.kjv: But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.
verses.web: But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust and enticed.
verses.ct: Instead, each person is tempted when they're dragged away and lured by their own desires.

verses.kjv: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.
verses.web: Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin. The sin, when it is full grown, produces death.
verses.ct: Then desire conceives and gives birth to sin, and sin, when it's fully grown, gives birth to death.

verses.kjv: Do not err, my beloved brethren.
verses.web: Don’t be deceived, my beloved brothers.
verses.ct: Don't be deceived, my dear brothers and sisters.

verses.kjv: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.
verses.web: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom can be no variation, nor turning shadow.
verses.ct: Every good and perfect gift comes from above, coming down from the Father of lights. He never changes or shifts like a moving shadow.

verses.kjv: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.
verses.web: Of his own will he gave birth to us by the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures.
verses.ct: By his own choice, he gave us new life through the word of truth, so that we would be like the firstfruits of everything he created.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
verses.web: So, then, my beloved brothers, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger;
verses.ct: Understand this, my dear brothers and sisters: everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry.

verses.kjv: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.
verses.web: for the anger of man doesn’t produce the righteousness of God.
verses.ct: Human anger doesn't produce the righteousness that God desires.

verses.kjv: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.
verses.web: Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.
verses.ct: So strip away every form of moral filth and the evil that overflows around you. Humbly receive the word that has been planted in you — it has the power to save your souls.

verses.kjv: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.
verses.web: But be doers of the word, and not only hearers, deluding your own selves.
verses.ct: Don't just listen to the word. Do what it says. Otherwise, you're only fooling yourselves.

verses.kjv: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:
verses.web: For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a mirror;
verses.ct: Anyone who listens to the word but doesn't act on it is like someone who looks at their face in a mirror,

verses.kjv: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.
verses.web: for he sees himself, and goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was.
verses.ct: takes a look, walks away, and immediately forgets what they looked like.

verses.kjv: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.
verses.web: But he who looks into the perfect law of freedom and continues, not being a hearer who forgets, but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in what he does.
verses.ct: But the person who looks carefully into the perfect law that sets people free — and keeps at it, not forgetting what they heard but actually doing it — that person will be blessed in everything they do.

verses.kjv: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion is vain.
verses.web: If anyone among you thinks himself to be religious while he doesn’t bridle his tongue, but deceives his heart, this man’s religion is worthless.
verses.ct: If anyone considers themselves religious but doesn't control their tongue, they're deceiving their own heart, and their religion is worthless.

verses.kjv: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.
verses.web: Pure religion and undefiled before our God and Father is this: to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained by the world.
verses.ct: The religion that God our Father accepts as pure and genuine is this: to care for orphans and widows in their suffering, and to keep yourself unstained by the world.
